title: UK police probe Nigel Farage over ‘knife’ comment
text:
Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage | Isabel Infantes/AFP via Getty Images UK police probe Nigel Farage over ‘knife’ comment The leader of the Brexit Party said he was using a metaphor for cutting bureaucrats in the government.

U.K. police are looking into comments by Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage in which he said he intended to take a "knife" to civil servants, the Guardian reported.

At a party rally in Newport, South Wales on Saturday 21 September, Farage told the crowd that, “once Brexit is done, we will take the knife to the pen-pushers in Whitehall.”

The comments were reported multiple times to police on Twitter as incitement to violence. “We have been made aware of comments made last night in Newport and we are looking into these allegations. Thanks,” said the Gwent force on its social media account.

In response, Farage tweeted that he was using a metaphor for staff reduction in government. “I should have said ‘take the axe’, which is a more traditional term for cuts,” he said.
description: The leader of the Brexit Party said he was using a metaphor for cutting bureaucrats in the government.
